discourse_list.title: MIP0c12-SP3: Subproposal for Core Personnel Onboarding (MIP Editor)

content.content: MIP0c12-SP3: Subproposal for Core Personnel Onboarding (MIP Editor)  Preamble MIP0c12-SP#: 3 Author: David Utrobin(@David.utro) Contributors: n/a Status: Obsolete Date Applied: 2021-02-01 Date Ratified: yyyy-mm-dd --- Core Personnel Role: MIP Editor Proposed applicant: David Utrobin   Application Form   Motivation  The MIPs process is central to how MakerDAO operates. Having a strong group of MIP editors is crucial to the health of the MIPs process and the smooth progression and growth of the Maker Protocol. My desire has always been to serve MakerDAO impactfully, helping in its path towards greater and greater succcess. One important building block towards that success is having responsible and competent individuals in mandated roles, such as this one. Since the launch of the MIPs framework, Charles St. Louis has been the sole MIP-Editor, and I think it’s time for one more. I am a good fit for this role for a number of reasons;  I am a long-time community member, being at MakerDAO for four years, being employed by the Maker Foundation for two and a half of those years, and planning to transition back into the community as the Foundation fulfulls its goal of dissolution. I have a well-rounded understanding of how the Protocol works, how governance works, how the MIPs framework works, and a great eye for quality and detail. In my role at the Community Development Department in the Foundation I’ve regularly practiced all of the skills required by the MIP-Editor role. These include regular usage of git and GitHub, giving thoughtful and important feedback, performing follow-ups with project leads, communicating updates and notices, information maintenance, and more. I have good relationships with all of the mandated actors, and a good understanding of the emerging organizational structure here at MakerDAO.   Lastly, I would like to note that the expectation is that more MIP-Editors would come on board to help decentralize the task and role. I hope to come on as one of the MIP-editors, and intend to contribute to efforts outside of this role as well. In particular, I am involved with the Community Development team, Governance Communications team, and the Governance Domain Team.    Credentials   Work Experience   Current:   Community Development Lead @ Maker Foundation  Lead the Tuesday community call for over two years. Designed and operates the Meetup Grants Program. Designed and operates the Governance Call Summary Team. Serves on the CDIP approval committee at comdev. Wrote the original SCD and MCD FAQs. Started Awesome MakerDAO. MIPs Related:  Co-authored MIP24: Emergency Voting System Alternates with Charles to give the weekly MIPs Update.   Other relevant public work:  Former Moderator reddit.com/r/MakerDAO/  Contributor Awesome Makerdao  Independently published a couple of articles on Medium         Past:  Operations Manager @ Vitozon, an Ecommerce startup. Administrative Officer @ Baruch College, MA Arts Administration  program. BA Corporate Communications @ Baruch College        Relevant Information   Github Account: @Davidutro   MakerDAO Forum Account: @Davidutro   Rocketchat Account: @David.u   Twitter Account: @Davidutro   LinkedIn Account: David Utrobin
content.GPT-summary: The post is a proposal for the addition of a new MIP editor to the MakerDAO team. The author explains their qualifications and experience, and notes the importance of having a strong group of MIP editors for the health of the MIPs process and the Maker Protocol. A 3rd party could give entirely positive feedback on the proposal, constructive criticism, or ask questions about the proposal.
GPT-discussion-categories: Author of proposal is explaining proposal

content.content: Good to see this, @Davidutro. However,   MIPc12 will be either removed or suspended with the Core Unit Operating Model.   The idea is that MIP Editors will be named by Governance Facilitators. image2322×316 92.6 KB   @charlesstlouis  will be grandfathered in the transition until someone is formally named.
GPT-discussion-categories: 3rd party giving constructive criticism of proposal

content.content: Ah, wasn’t aware of this. Thanks for the notice.
What took you so long? Long overdue David.
